segments.text: Oh wow, I need to record this. I'm about 2200 meters up and I just spotted a herd of chamois on the ridge above me.
There's... let me count... seven of them. Six adults and what looks like a younger one. They're maybe 100 meters away.
I'm going to stay very still. They haven't noticed me yet. The wind's in my favor, blowing from them toward me.
They're grazing on the alpine grass poking through the snow. So graceful. Those horns are incredible - they curve back like hooks.
This is why I come to the mountains. You can't see this in the city. This is pure, wild nature.
The young one is playing, jumping from rock to rock. The adults are keeping watch while they eat.
One of the big males just looked up... he's scanning the area. They're so alert. Has to be with eagles and wolves around.
Oh! Speaking of eagles - there's one circling above them right now. Golden eagle, I think. Huge wingspan.
The chamois have noticed it too. They've grouped closer together, all facing different directions. Smart.
I wish I had a better camera lens for this. My phone's zoom isn't doing them justice.
Wait, one of them spotted me. It's staring right at me. Don't move, Lena. Don't move.
It's still watching but it doesn't seem alarmed. I must look like just another rock from this distance.
Okay, it looked away. Back to grazing. This is absolutely magical. I've been sitting here for... what, 15 minutes now?
They're starting to move upslope. Following the ridgeline toward the summit. Moving like they're floating over the rocks.
And they're gone. Disappeared behind the ridge. What an incredible encounter. My heart's still racing.

environment.background_sounds: wind, distant bird calls, rocks shifting under boots
